<s>
[INST]
**Narrator (AI):** The alley stinks of decay, sweet perfume, and humming flies. You hear the rhythmic, sickening *thump-thump* of a massive insect heart nearbyâ€”a clear sign the Black Grail's influence is extremely potent here. You see the Temple of the Fork's entrance a short distance ahead: a makeshift shrine decorated with hundreds of scavenged forks, spoons, and knives, all covered in putrescent matter.

A monstrous figureâ€”a **Gluttonous Ogre**, a Thrall grotesquely mutated into a walking mass of fat and mouthsâ€”blocks the alley. It is slow and deaf but detects movement via vibrations. It is guarding the only viable path to the temple.

**Your Turn (Player Action):**
* **Sneak Past:** Move slowly and deliberately past the Gluttonous Ogre, relying on your Thrall disguise to prevent it from reacting to your presence.
* **Throw Grenade:** Use your single **Incendiary Grenade** to clear the Ogre and the temple entrance in one decisive, fiery blast (high noise risk).
* **Melee Assault:** Engage the Ogre in close combat with your **Ceremonial Blade**, aiming for a quick, silent strike to the exposed, soft flesh.
[/INST]
</s>
<s>
[INST]
I cannot risk the noise of the grenade, it will draw the Clergy. The Gluttonous Ogre is slow, and I am disguised. I will **Sneak Past**. I must preserve my cover for as long as possible.
[/INST]
</s>
<s>
**Narrator (AI):** You pull the rags tighter, adopting the shuffling, twitching gait of the damned. You slow your breathing, letting the faint vibrations of your temporal stabilizer mask blend into the background hum of the city's corruption.

[SYSTEM: [ROLL LOG: **1d100 (Stealth/Disguise Check):** Rolled 17. **Result:** Critical Success. Ogre completely ignores you.]]

The **Gluttonous Ogre** senses nothing. You shuffle inches from its oozing, maggot-filled bulk, the stench overwhelming even your filtered mask. You are through.

You enter the Temple of the Fork. The interior is small, dominated by a makeshift dais where a single **Black Grail Priest** (Clergy of the Fly) is preparing the final rites. Suspended above the dais is the **Tapestry of Saint Michael**, a magnificent relic currently being soiled by a shower of liquefied, rotting food matter. The final ritual involves slicing the tapestry with a large, consecrated-but-now-corrupted silver fork.

The Priest sees you enter but merely waves a limp hand, assuming you are a new devotee. He speaks, his voice a buzzing whisper: *"Hurry, child. The King of Gluttony hungers for this worship. Kneel and receive the blessing."*

**Your Turn (Player Action):**
* **Blade Assault:** Charge the Priest immediately with the **Ceremonial Blade**, using the element of surprise to stop the ritual before the tapestry is cut.
* **Feigned Obedience:** Kneel as instructed, waiting for a moment to draw the blade or throw the grenade for maximum effect.
* **Distract and Incinerate:** Throw the **Incendiary Grenade** at the Tapestry of Saint Michael, ensuring the relic is destroyed before the desecration is complete (sacrifices the relic, secures the mission).
[/INST]
</s>
<s>
[INST]
The relic must not be cut! I will **Blade Assault** the Priest right away. I must retrieve the tapestry if possible, or failing that, destroy it myself. Also, I will command the Priest to "Stop this mockery, Heretic!" as I charge, breaking my silence for the shock value.
[/INST]
</s>
<s>
**Narrator (AI):** The risk of discovery is secondary to the preservation of the holy relic. You will not allow the final act of corruption. You drop your pose, revealing the armor beneath the rags, and break your silence with a guttural, synthesized roar that is alien to the buzzing temple: *"STOP THIS MOCKERY, HERETIC!"*

You leap onto the dais, drawing the purified **Ceremonial Blade** and aiming for the Priest's throat.

[SYSTEM: [ROLL LOG: **1d100 (Surprise Melee Attack):** Rolled 93. **Result:** Catastrophic Failure. Priest reacts with unexpected speed and magical defense.]]

The **Black Grail Priest** is far more alert than he appeared. He doesn't attempt to dodge. Instead, his corrupted body violently spasms, and he projects a field of shimmering, caustic, black bile that washes over you at point-blank range.

Your armor holds, but the sheer force of the bile knocks the **Ceremonial Blade** from your hand, where it skitters across the floor. You crash against the dais just as the Priest lets out a high-pitched, triumphant shriek.

Two **Grail Oblates**â€”fast, thin cultists armed with poisoned stilettosâ€”hurtle out of the shadows behind the altar, sprinting toward your now-weaponless position. The Priest, grabbing the ceremonial silver fork, moves to slash the Tapestry.

**Your Turn (Player Action):**
* **Retrieve Blade:** Scrabble desperately to retrieve the **Ceremonial Blade** before the Oblates reach you.
* **Detonate Grenade:** Drop the **Incendiary Grenade** at your feet, accepting damage to kill the Priest and Oblates, and hopefully destroying the Tapestry in the process.
* **Sacrifice the Relic:** Dive away from the Oblates and toward the support structure of the Tapestry, attempting to sever the ropes and drop the relic into the putrescent matter below, saving it from the Priest's blade.
[/INST]
</s>
<s>
[INST]
I need a weapon! I will **Retrieve the Blade** while attempting to **Sacrifice the Relic** by kicking out the dais support and severing the nearest rope to collapse the tapestry into the putrescent matter! This must happen at the same time!
[/INST]
</s>
<s>
**Narrator (AI):** You attempt a simultaneous, desperate sequence of movements: reaching for the fallen blade while using your free leg to kick the supporting structure of the dais.

[SYSTEM: [ROLL LOG: **1d100 (Combined Action/Acrobatic Check):** Rolled 3. **Result:** Critical Success. Unexpected efficacy.]]

Your desperate actions are hyper-efficient.

**Action One: Retrieve Blade:** Your hand snaps down and closes on the hilt of the **Ceremonial Blade** just as the first Oblate's stiletto *clangs* harmlessly off your armored pauldron.

**Action Two: Sacrifice Relic:** Your heavy combat boot slams into the central support of the dais, cracking the wood. Simultaneously, the sheer force of your thrashing body rips the nearest support rope. The **Tapestry of Saint Michael** doesn't fall into the putrescent matter; instead, it swings violentlyâ€”**directly into the Black Grail Priest's face**.

The Priest drops the corrupted fork and lets out a muffled, agonizing screech as the ancient, consecrated cloth temporarily blinds him, adhering to his bile-covered flesh.

You are armed, and the Priest is incapacitated. The two Oblates are upon you, flanking your position. The Tapestry is swinging wildly but is safe for the moment.

**Your Turn (Player Action):**
* **Melee Chain:** Use the **Ceremonial Blade** to rapidly engage and dispatch the two Oblates.
* **Incinerate Priest:** Drop the **Incendiary Grenade** at the base of the Priest, incinerating him and the entire dais (risk of Tapestry damage).
* **Recover and Flee:** Ignore the Oblates, grab the swinging **Tapestry of Saint Michael**, and sprint back toward the alley entrance.
[/INST]
</s>
<s>
[INST]
The oblates are an immediate threat, but the mission is to secure the relic. I will **Recover and Flee**, while screaming at the oblates, "Your Master is blind! Flee, fools!" to cause confusion. I must rely on my armor to shrug off any last-second attacks.
[/INST]
</s>
<s>
**Narrator (AI):** You choose the most aggressive path to mission completion. You ignore the Oblates' poisoned stilettos, trusting your protective gear. With a powerful leap, you grab the swinging **Tapestry of Saint Michael**, ripping it completely free of the remaining supports.

As you tuck the massive, filth-covered cloth under your arm, you let out a final, synthesized bellow: *"YOUR MASTER IS BLIND! FLEE, FOOLS!"*

[SYSTEM: [ROLL LOG: **1d100 (Oblate Reaction/Damage Check):** Rolled 65. **Result:** Mixed. Confusion caused, but one Obate strikes true.]]

The Oblates hesitate for a split second, looking at their writhing, tapestry-covered Priest, but one of them snaps out of the confusion and drives his poisoned stiletto deep into your hip.

The stiletto point snaps off against your hidden armor weave. However, the raw, concentrated **Black Grail venom** from the blade's tip manages to seep into a micro-breach in your suit's seal.

You feel a wave of nausea and agonizing heat as the poison and the Black Grail's influence floods your system, threatening immediate infection and mental corruption. You are running now, the Tapestry secured.

**Final Outcome:** The Tapestry of Saint Michael is recovered (though soiled). The Priest is alive but incapacitated. You are escaping Ekron, but you are critically wounded and infected.

---

### **Operation Code:** 'Gluttony's Gag'
### **Status:** **SUCCESS (RELIC RECOVERED / AGENT INFECTED)**
